channel.title: Kotaku
channel.description: Gaming Reviews, News, Tips and More.

item.title: Twitch Mega Streamer xQc Signed By Gambling Company For $100 Million
item.description:
Twitch’s biggest streamer, Félix “xQc” Lengyel, is signing with the company’s newest rival, Kick, a streaming platform that offers better revenue splits and also appears to be centered around online gambling. The non-exclusive deal is valued at up to $100 million over two years, and is the latest and biggest blow to…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Diablo IV Devs Say Future Update Will Fix Annoying Gems
item.description:
If you’ve been murderin’ your way through dungeons in Diablo IV recently, you’ve likely killed a lot of monsters, found a lot of loot, and also ended up with a half dozen (or more) gems in your inventory taking up space that weapons and armor could occupy. That can be annoying, and some players have asked for a gem…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: 8 Games To Play This Weekend
item.description:
The week is over. Juneteenth is almost here. Let’s all breathe a sigh of relief and focus on the important things: What games will you be playing this weekend? Maybe we can give you some ideas.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Claire Jackson

item.title: Diablo IV Fans Won't Stop Trying To Find The Cow Level That Likely Isn't There
item.description:
One of the recurring gags in the Diablo series is the secret cow level. This refers to a secret area that is filled with weapon-toting cows who attack the player should they be unfortunate enough to stumble upon it. It first debuted in Diablo II, then made an appearance in Diablo III. This gag is such a prominent…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: Someone At Nintendo Snuck Pride Month Into The Switch's eShop
item.description:
It’s Pride Month, meaning there are gay flags all over the place. This is true for the Nintendo eShop, too, though you may have to look a little more closely to find it. Scroll down for a while in the Featured section and you’ll see that someone has quietly snuck in a rainbow flag to call attention to games with queer…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Levi Winslow

item.title: Vinland Saga Second Season’s Lack Of Action Is A Good Thing
item.description:
Like moths to a brilliant, roaring flame, anime fans are drawn to heroes who share the same unshakeable quality as Attack on Titan’s Eren Jaeger: the will to commit unspeakable acts of violence for the sake of their own freedom. But oftentimes fans fail to appreciate that sometimes anime with nonviolent stories can be…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Isaiah Colbert

item.title: Diablo IV Fans Think It’s Stingy With XP, So Blizzard Is Promising Changes
item.description:
Diablo IV fans feel Blizzard’s action RPG has an XP problem, in that players feel like it’s hard to level up in a timely manner. Fortunately, the studio says it’s willing to hear that criticism out and make changes. In a “Campfire Chat” stream featuring members of the dev team, Blizzard explained that it is working on…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: 40+ Weird Vintage Video Game Ads We Can’t Stop Thinking About
item.description:
For a long time, perhaps due to the infancy of the medium, there was no “right” way to advertise home video games. As a result, some of the earliest video game companies—including some we now recognize as major industry players, like Nintendo—ended up creating some of the most bizarre TV commercials, print ads, and …

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ashley Bardhan

item.title: Diablo IV Really Needs One More Skill Slot
item.description:
Diablo IV is a very good video game. It features all the stuff I want out of a good Diablo game, including lots of loot, thousands of monsters to kill, more loot, big dungeons to explore, cool skills to unlock, and of course, a ton more loot. But it also feels like it’s missing something: a dedicated slot for your…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: You Can Get Tears Of The Kingdom’s Best Shield Almost Immediately
item.description:
The early hours of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom don’t give you a really good shield. The game spends a lot of time showing you how to fuse items to your shield to get some cool utility out of it, but if you want one that will take a lot of hits? Your early shield options are pretty lacking. Luckily,…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: This Tears Of The Kingdom Randomizer Is Perfect Chaos
item.description:
If you’ve already put 100+ hours into The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom, you might be asking yourself how you can spice up this Hylian love affair between you and Link’s latest adventure. Well, might I suggest a randomizer that puts enemies in places they’re not supposed to be? Because a modder has made a…

item.category: the legend of zelda a link to the past
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: The West's First Fire Emblem Comes To Nintendo Switch Online
item.description:
Nintendo has announced Fire Emblem: The Blazing Blade is coming to Nintendo Switch Online, and a lot of fans are probably feeling nostalgic about it because it was the first game in the tactical fantasy series to make its way to the west.

Read more...
item.category: fire emblem new mystery of the emblem
item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: Let's Rank All The Spider-Man Games, From Worst To Best
item.description:
Spider-Man, Spider-Man! Does whatever a spider can! Has he had, lots of games? Yup and many, are the same. Watch out, here’s our ranking of (most of) them!

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: Why Is Starfield 30FPS? Space Sandwiches, Probably
item.description:
After years of speculation, Starfield director Todd Howard recently confirmed that the open-world RPG will only run at 30fps on Xbox Series X/S, where it’s a console exclusive. While some fans were immediately dismayed, others have pointed out that there’s likely a good reason for capping the game’s framerate lower…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: The Real-Life Dog Behind Red Dead Redemption 2’s Cain Has Died
item.description:
Einstein, the dog who provided the motion capture performance for Red Dead Redemption 2’s pooch Cain, has passed away according to the pup’s owner. I’m sorry to bring you this sad news.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: Final Fantasy XVI Devs List Their Top 3 FF Games, And The Top One Is Surprising Fans
item.description:
In a recent interview with IGN, three Final Fantasy XVI directors revealed their top three Final Fantasy games of all time. Surprisingly, none of the directors’ picks included mainstream fan favorites titles like mega-popular Final Fantasy VII. Instead, the devs earmarked deep-cut Final Fantasy entries not often…

item.dc:creator: Isaiah Colbert

item.title: The Last Of Us Comes To Universal Studios’ Halloween Horror Nights
item.description:
If you’ve ever found yourself playing The Last of Us and getting frustrated that the horror was only happening behind the safety of a screen, well, I have good news for you. Starting in September, The Last of Us’ signature brand of post-apocalyptic terror is coming to Universal Studios during the theme park’s…

item.dc:creator: Claire Jackson

item.title: Nintendo Switch Piracy Subreddit Banned After Giant Tears Of The Kingdom Leak
item.description:
The Nintendo Switch piracy subreddit r/newyuzupiracy managed to fly under the radar for years. However, on June 13, three years after it was originally created, Reddit banned the forum after it blew up in the wake of the massive pre-release leak of The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Diablo IV Player Can’t Believe What Just Killed Perma-Killed His 172-Hour Druid
item.description:
Diablo IV’s Hardcore mode is not for the faint of heart. Anything that kills your character will leave them permanently dead, no matter what level they were, how much time you invested, or what gear they had. So Twitch streamer Quin69 was understandably overwhelmed with confusion and rage when his level 91 Druid with…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Tears Of The Kingdom Fans Are Fighting With Beyblades Now
item.description:
This wont come as a huge surprise, not after learning that you can build a working computer in Nintendo’s open-world adventure, but it’s still neat: turns out the new Zelda’s construction abilities let you build your own Beyblade match.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: Concept Art From A Canceled, Live-Action Robotech Movie
item.description:
For 15 years now, people in Hollywood have been trying to get a live-action Robotech movie made. Specifically, a movie based on Robotech’s first and most popular season, which was a Western repackaging of Japanese masterpiece Macross.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: They're Making A Mickey Mouse Metroidvania, And It Looks Grand
item.description:
When you’re working with a character whose legacy is as long and storied as Mickey Mouse’s, there’s a lot of history to contend with. But according to Disney Illusion Island creative director and Diala Studios CEO AJ Grand-Scrutton, the House of Mouse was willing to play ball on his studio’s ideas for a cooperative…

item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: Reddit's CEO Is Just Making Everything Worse
item.description:
As you may have seen over the past week, Reddit—the “last page of the internet”—has not been having a good time, after the company’s CEO decided to oversee some changes that affected some very popular apps that people were using to access the site. That CEO, Steve Huffman, is now doing some prominent interviews in an…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: Replica Xbox 360 Controller Nails The Vibes, But Lack Of Wireless Hurts
item.description:
The Xbox’s gamepad wasn’t a hit right out of the gate. The original console’s first controller, often nicknamed “the Duke” for its comically large size, is remembered for just that: being enormous. Its followup, the “Controller S,” was serviceable but not particularly notable.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Claire Jackson

item.title: Playboy Founder’s Son Funds His Pokémon Obsession With An OnlyFans
item.description:
Marston Hefner, the son of the late Playboy founder Hugh Hefner, is probably the most down-bad person on the planet. He started an OnlyFans account this year to sell tasteful and steamy nudes, and then used that secondary income to fund his habit of collecting Pokémon cards.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Levi Winslow

item.title: Save A Bunch On Great Switch Games In Nintendo's Latest Summer Sale
item.description:
Another season, another Switch sale. In celebration of the summer solstice or just to pad those quarterly earnings, several Switch exclusives and excellent indie games have huge discounts right now. If you need something to play by the pool, like say a 2D side-scrolling arcade-y throwback like Metroid Dread, now’s the…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Halo Infinite Finally Adding Fan-Favorite Zombies Mode
item.description:
Since the old days of Halo 2 on the original Xbox, many players (myself included) have been enjoying zombie-inspired competitive modes in these games. And now, finally, Halo Infinite, the latest, somewhat beleaguered entry in the franchise, is adding its own version of this popular game mode in its upcoming season…

item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: What Each Edition Of Final Fantasy XVI Gets You
item.description:
Players worldwide are dipping their toes into the demo of what could be one of the biggest video game releases of the summer: Final Fantasy XVI. If you checked out the demo and enjoyed Square Enix’s Game of Thrones-meets-Devil May Cry epic fantasy enough to put the game on your “Must Buy” list, here’s a little guide…

item.title: Pokémon Go Company’s Next Game Makes Playing Monster Hunter A Breeze
item.description:
The same things that make Monster Hunter super popular—wild boss designs, deep loot progressions, and big multiplayer brawls—are what can make it feel impenetrable to the uninitiated. I have no idea if Monster Hunter Now, Niantic’s latest augmented reality social game, can be as successful as Monster Hunter World or …

item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Twitch Enrages Streamers Again With Convoluted New Revenue Share Program
item.description:
Twitch’s mid-life platform crisis continues. After rolling out controversial new 50/50 revenue splits for top streamers last fall, the massively popular online gaming hangout is now announcing a new “Partner Plus Program” that will return certain channels to the previous 70/30 split, but with tons of caveats. It’s…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Tears Of The Kingdom Glitch Lets Link Double-Jump Infinitely
item.description:
A newly discovered The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom glitch allows Link to endlessly double-jump his way to victory, using the Fuse ability to its most natural end.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ashley Bardhan

item.title: Microsoft Is Done Making Games For Xbox One
item.description:
In a new interview, Xbox game studio chief Matt Booty confirmed that the company is done developing first-party games for the older Xbox One consoles, explaining that Microsoft has “moved on” from the prior-generation machine and is now focused on Xbox Series X/S. It’s yet another sign that the old consoles are being…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: Tears Of The Kingdom Players Are Making Music With Lasers And Zonai Stakes
item.description:
Not only does The Legend of Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom simulate wind, electricity, aerodynamics, and inertia, it also simulates the phenomenon of pressure waves detected by our ears: i.e. sound. As players have been slowly realizing, when stuck in the ground to various depths, Zonai Stakes vibrate at different…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Claire Jackson

item.title: Counter-Strike: Global Offensive Pro Dies In Russia-Ukraine War
item.description:
The war between Russia and Ukraine, which began in 2014 but ramped up in February 2022 as Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, has claimed yet another life. 21-year-old Counter-Strike: Global Offensive pro Ostap “0ni” Onistrat was reportedly killed in action defending his home country of Ukraine.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Levi Winslow

item.title: Layers Of Fear: The Kotaku Review
item.description:
There’s a lot to admire about Layers of Fear, Polish studio Bloober Team’s new reimagining of its (relatively) excellent surreal, psychological adventure horror series.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Ashley Bardhan

item.title: Final Fantasy XVI's Menu Screen Does Something Ridiculously Neat
item.description:
Final Fantasy XVI doesn’t hit PlayStation 5 until June 22, but players have already gotten a chance to check out the Game of Thrones-influenced action-RPG early thanks to a two-hour demo on the PlayStation Store. It’s excellent, and also reveals some cool features I hadn’t been aware of before. My favorite is a simple…

item.dc:creator: Ethan Gach

item.title: Inside Scoop On Tom Holland’s Fortnite Collab: He Was Really Adorable And A ‘Good Guy’
item.description:
The Hollywood Reporter published a profile of Tom Holland on June 14 and revealed to the world how cute and nice Uncharted actor Tom Holland is. As it flew around Twitter, eliciting enthusiastic GIF reactions and photosets of Holland looking deep in thought (he is multitalented), video game writer Eric Stirpe revealed…

item.dc:creator: Ashley Bardhan

item.title: These Two New Street Fighter 6 Characters Are Taking Over The Internet
item.description:
Capcom’s Street Fighter series has given us some of the most recognizable and iconic game characters in history. But when attached to Street Fighter V, a game with a rocky 2016 launch it never fully recovered from, those characters got relatively little attention. Thankfully, Street Fighter 6 has reinvigorated the…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Matt Petras

item.title: Diablo Cosplay Is As Far From Hell As Possible
item.description:
Cinderys is a professional cosplayer from France who has been active in the scene for almost a decade now. Over the years she’s cosplayed as a bunch of Blizzard characters, from World of Warcraft to Hearthstone, but her latest Diablo work is terrifyingly good.

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: Mysterious New GTA Online Shirt Has Fans Convinced Rockstar Is Teasing GTA 6
item.description:
Do you hear that? The faint sound of thousands of Grand Theft Auto fans going wild online over the latest (possible) GTA 6 conspiracy. This time it involves an odd shirt with a coded message that briefly appeared in GTA Online after the latest update. And while the shirt seems to be gone now, the mystery around it…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: Steam Update Looks Nice, Makes Stuff Easier
item.description:
Steam! We use it every day, sometimes all day, but as functional as it is, it has also—for much of its now decades-long lifespan—looked like ass. That’s something Valve were looking to address in a big new update that’s rolling out worldwide right now, and it’s something they’ve largely succeeded in. 3

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: Fans Spot Striking Similarities Between Steampunk Game Trailer And BioShock Infinite's
item.description:
During the Summer Game Fest Xbox Showcase, developer inXile revealed its new steampunk roleplaying game called Clockwork Revolution. “New” though the game may be, the trailer had some viewers experiencing deja vu, as in some ways it appears to ape ten-year-old trailers for Irrational Games’ BioShock Infinite…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Isaiah Colbert

item.title: Lies Of P Is Giving Steampunk Bloodborne With 60FPS Performance
item.description:
FromSoftware’s Bloodborne will probably linger in your mind when playing Lies of P. While the similarities are obvious, the Pinocchio Chalamet-led Soulslike is more than just a xerox of the 2015 Victorian-era masterpiece, and the recent demo makes it clear that developer Round8 Studio is more enamored with FromSoft’s…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Levi Winslow

item.title: Some Very Cool Strategy Games Have Been Shown Off This Week
item.description:
Strategy games—of all persuasions, I’m not just talking about armies on a map—aren’t usually the stars of big gaming shows, because they tend to be more sedate affairs, not well-suited to blockbuster trailers and breathless announcements. Over the last week, however, I have seen a lot of very promising ones announced…

item.dc:creator: Luke Plunkett

item.title: Seth Rogen's One Mario Movie Sequel Request: Give Donkey Kong Pants
item.description:
The Super Mario Bros. Movie is officially out on DVD and Blu-ray. To promote it, Universal Pictures has released some new behind-the-scenes videos about the blockbuster animated adaptation of Nintendo’s beloved series. The videos provide some interesting insight into how the film was created, but more importantly,…

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: Tears of the Kingdom Fans Are Building Computers Now, Because Of Course [Update]
item.description:
I mean, it was only a matter of time, right? Nintendo’s hit open-world game Tears of the Kingdom features a surprisingly robust and dynamic physics system you can build with, so it stands to reason that if you create a few “if this then that” scenarios, then bam, you basically have the working fundamentals of a…

item.dc:creator: Claire Jackson

item.title: 10 Highlights From Classic Mega Man’s Newly Released Design Doc
item.description:
At the recent Summer Game Fest Capcom announced the launch of Capcom Town, its new…website…online community…thing? That will act as a hub of sorts for, er, Capcom stuff of some sort. (Capcom just turned 40, so maybe it’s a midlife crisis sort of thing.)

Read more...
item.dc:creator: Claire Jackson

item.title: Sure, It's Dark Souls With Guns, But More Importantly: Dog
item.description:
I came into my demo for Remnant II at Summer Game Fest with zero expectations. I didn’t play the original game and only knew it as “Dark Souls with guns.” What I didn’t expect was to become immediately caught in its web, not because of its shooting or looting, but by the canine companion Gunfire Games gives the…

item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard

item.title: Let's Explain The Spider-Verse Joke That Went Over Some Viewers' Head
item.description:
While many of the quippy jokes and tangential references in Spider-Man: Across the Spider-Verse landed with moviegoers, one particular blink-and-you’ll-miss-it gag managed to swing its way right over some viewers’ heads. In the spirit of explaining a joke, thus making its farcical nature all the more compelling, let’s…

item.dc:creator: Isaiah Colbert

item.title: GTA Online Just Got Its Best New Feature In Years
item.description:
Grand Theft Auto Online’s latest update, San Andreas Mercenaries, adds new missions and quality-of-life changes to the aging online game. However, while that content is cool and all, the best thing added in this update is probably (and surprisingly) a new menu. I know, doesn’t sound very exciting. But what it lacks in…

item.dc:creator: Zack Zwiezen

item.title: Overwatch 2 Can’t Afford A Season This Mid
item.description:
Overwatch 2 is getting its ass beat online lately and for good reason. With the exception of its Pride event, it’s been nothing but bad news for the hero shooter between Blizzard announcing it was gutting its planned PvE suite of skill trees and replayable hero missions to charging $15 for its story missions. It’s…

item.dc:creator: Kenneth Shepard
